questions.text:
Thank you for participating in the NENA 2024 PSAP Survey. We know that your time is valuable and we appreciate you sharing your data with us. The information you share will help NENA better understand staffing and call processing realities throughout the industry and support meaningful solutions, advocacy, and future planning for the 9-1-1 community.

The survey will take approximately 30-45 minutes and consists of 99 question. Your voice matters, and your participation makes a difference.
What is the base population serviced by the PSAP:
What is the peak population serviced by the PSAP:
What are most common factors contiubting to the population variation:
Select the PSAP classification:
What services does the PSAP provide (select one or more):
Please list any additional services that you provide:
What is the PSAP operational governance:
What agencies does the PSAP serve and how many of each:
Types of calls answered by PSAP:
Total of 9-1-1 calls answered in the last calendar year:
Total of all 10-digit emergency calls answered in the last calendar year:
Total of all non-emergency calls answered in the last calendar year:
Total of all SMS/Text sessions answered in the last calendar year:
Total of all TTY/TDD sessions answered in the last calendar year:
Total number of Law Enforcement events processed in the last calendar year:
Total number of Fire events processed in the last calendar year:
Total number of EMS events processed in the last calendar year:
Total number of other events processed in the last calendar year:
Estimated radio keyups in the last calendar year:
Average number of radio keyups per hour in the last calendar year:
How many calls were transferred in the last calendar year?
Of the calls transferred, how many were transferred to a secondary PSAP?
Of the calls transferred, how many were transferred due to misrouting?
Total number of shifts
Number of call takers employed per shift
Number of radio dispatchers employed per shift
Number of supervisors employed per shift
Number of executive and administrative personnel in the PSAP
Number of IT support staff in the PSAP
Number of full time shifts
Number of part time shifts
Number of temporary shifts
What is your optimum number of staff (if fully staffed)?
Name of CAD vendor
Name of Phone vendor
Name of Radio vendor
Name of Call Handling Equipment (CHE) vendor
Additional software used
Notification Process used
Do you monitor 9-1-1 call answering times
Do you monitor 9-1-1 call processing times
Do you monitor admin line call answering times
Do you monitor admin line call processing times
Percentage of 9-1-1/10-digit emergency calls answered in 10 seconds or less
Percentage of 9-1-1/10-digit emergency calls answered in 15 seconds or less
Percentage of 9-1-1/10-digit emergency calls answered in 20 seconds or less
Percentage of 9-1-1/10-digit emergency calls answered in 40 seconds or less
Percentage of 9-1-1/10-digit emergency calls answered in 60 seconds or less
Percentage of Admin/Non-Emergency calls answered in 10 seconds or less
Percentage of Admin/Non-Emergency calls answered in 15 seconds or less
Percentage of Admin/Non-Emergency calls answered in 20 seconds or less
Percentage of Admin/Non-Emergency calls answered in 40 seconds or less
Percentage of Admin/Non-Emergency calls answered in 60 seconds or less
Do you have SLAs to partner agencies
Percentage of Law Enforcement Emergency calls dispatched within the SLA
Percentage of Fire Department Emergency calls dispatched within the SLA
Percentage of EMS Emergency calls dispatched within the SLA
Percentage of Law Enforcement Non-Emergency calls dispatched within the SLA
Percentage of Fire Department Non-Emergency calls dispatched wiithin the SLA
Percentage of Medical Non-Emergency calls dispatched within the SLA
Does your PSAP publish call answering times
Does your PSAP publish dispatch times
Do you have a written standard for call answering times
Do you have a written standard for call processing times
What written standards do you use for call answering and processing times
Do you employ a prioritization system to triage events
Which software do you use for triaging events.
Please identify any centre limitations or barriers to meeting standards that exist
What is the mean (average) call processing time per telecommunicator for law calls (in seconds)?
What is the mean (average) call processing time per telecommunicator for fire calls (in seconds)?
What is the mean (average) call processing time per telecommunicator for medical calls (in seconds)?
How many radio talk channels do you monitor?
How many are actively monitored?
How many are passively monitored?
How many are designated as primary channels?
How many are designated as secondary channels?
How many calls are transferred for processing (medical triage, etc)
Do you employ an AI assistant to screen non-emergency calls?
If so, what percentage of calls have been off-loaded?
Do you audit the calls being off-loaded?
If so, how many hours per week are dedicated to auditing the calls?
Do you have AI assistance in QA/QI?
If so, how many hours per week are dedicated to QA/QI?
Do you plan to implement an AI assistant to screen non-emergency calls?
If so, what percentage of calls do you plan to off-load?
Do you plan to audit the calls being off-loaded?
Do you plan to have AI assistance in QA/QI?
How long is your training program for new telecommunicators?
How many hours per week are dedicated to training?
Do you have a dedicated training staff?
If so, how many staff are dedicated to training?
How many telecommunicators are trainers?
How many hours per week do they spend training new telecommunicators?
Do you have a continuing education/continuous training program?
How many hours per week are spent in continuing education/continuous training?

Please list any additional duties for which your center is responsible or performs and the number of hours per week that each duty consumes (examples may include NCIC entries, inmate duties, analyses, reports, warrant processing, etc.)?

Thank you for completing the NENA 2024 PSAP Survey. Your participation is greatly appreciated and will help NENA better understand staffing and call processing standards. Your feedback is valuable throughout the industry and support meaningful solutions, advocacy, and future planning for the 9-1-1 community.
